719231f-a.text:
Cornelia Street and Sixth Avenue convergence, southwest from West 4th Street. The Avenue is to the left. Note the "El" pillars at West 3rd Street where this structure turns eastward. The curb line of W. 4th Street is at the lower right.

About 1900

J. J. Corell, photo
P. L. Sperr Collection

730220f-a.title: General view - [Manhattan - 4th Street - 6th Avenue (Northeast).]
730220f-a.text:
A general view, northeast from 4th Street and Sixth Ave., showing the spire of the Metropolitan Life Insurance Building, (Madison Ave., at 23rd St.,) in the distance.

April 3, 1926.

P. L. Sperr.

730219f-a.title: General view - [Manhattan - 4th Street - 6th Avenue (East).]
730219f-a.text:
A general view, east from 4th Street and Sixth Ave.

April 3, 1928.

P. L. Sperr.

730221f-a.title: General view - [Manhattan - 4th Street - 6th Avenue (Southeast).]
730221f-a.text:
A general view, southeast from 4th Street and Sixth Ave.

April 3, 1928.

P. L. Sperr.

710908f-a.text:
150-140 West 4th Street, (rear and side views), adjoining and east of the S.E. corner of Sixth Ave. Also shown are Nos. 147-135 West 4th Street, north side, between Sixth Ave., and Washington Square West. The Washington Square M.E. Church is at Nos. 135-139. Building No. 150 (bearing theatrical
signs) is a frame structure in 2 parts.

April 3, 1928.

P. L. Sperr.

Neg ~ 2377,St???? #138

710903f-a.text:
Washington Square Methodist Church, 135 West 4th Street, north side, between Sixth Avenue and Macdougal Street. This church antedates 1879.x

March 15, 1932.

P. L. Sperr.

710905f-b.text:
(1)
146-148-150 West 4th Street, adjoining the clearing on the S.E. corner of Sixth Avenue. The little white house with the real estate office is an old frame structure. The shed to the right was put up after the east side of Sixth Avenue was cleared.

March 11, 1932.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, looking towards Sixth Avenue, and showing no part of 146 except the electric sign "Pepper Pot".

Between 148 and 150 is the entrance to a one-story frame, originally a cow barn, behind 150 West 4th Street. In the 1920's this was occupied by 'The Samovar" tea room; their sign over the entrance is still faintly legible. Since the time of the first view the premises have evidently been
occupied by a Chinese Hand Laundry.

May 24, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.

710905f-a.text:

underway.
View 3, being later, shows a parking lot there.

View 2: September 1, 1928
View 3: February 24, 1933

710928f-a.text:
West 4th Street, south side, west of Sixth Ave.  The block front as seen under the Sixth Ave. Elevated tracks, is between Cornelia and Jones Streets.

May 24, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.

709304f-a.text:
Sixth Ave., west side, north from West 4th Street. Shown at the N.W. corner of Washington Place, is the R.C. Church of St. Joseph.

May 24, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.

709300f-a.text:
Sixth Avenue, east side, north from West 4th Street, showing this former subway construction site, subsequent to the recent demolition of the old Sixth Avenue "El." The automobile parking lots there are of recent origin. To the left and above the jumble of buildings at 8th Street appears the dominant Empire State Building.

March 8, 1939
Views 1, 2

P. L. Sperr

709300f-b.text:
Sixth Avenue, east side, north from West 4th Street, showing this former subway construction site, subsequent to the recent demolition of the old Sixth Avenue "El." The automobile parking lots there are of recent origin. To the left and above the jumble of buildings at 8th Street appears the dominant Empire State Building.

March 8, 1939
Views 1, 2

P. L. Sperr

710898f-a.text:
150-128 West 4th Street, adjoinig south side, from Sixth Avenue to MacDougal Street, No. 150 is a two-story frame house with a brick front.

1932.

J. Clarence Davies Collection, Museum of the City of New York
Negative No. 367

710906f-b.text:
149 to 145 West 4th Street, north side, east of Sixth Ave. (left, not shown) as viewed northeastward from the Ave. and across vacant 1ots on the east side of same. This set consists of a negative and positive photostat of an original photograph that was discoloring in the files.

March 25, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

710906f-a.text:
149 to 145 West 4th Street, north side, east of Sixth Ave. (left, not shown) as viewed northeastward from the Ave. and across vacant 1ots on the east side of same. This set consists of a negative and positive photostat of an original photograph that was discoloring in the files.

710909f-a.text:
172-74 and 182 West 4th Street, south side, west of Sixth Avenue, at the intersection of Jones and 4th Streets.

May 1, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

710910f-a.text:
177 and 9 W. 4th Street, north side, between Sixth Avenue and Sheridan Square, as viewed from Jones Street. This is a reversed print and the automobile shown is in front
of No. 179.

1939

Gift of Beecher Ogden

710911f-b.text:
175 to 179 W. 4th Street, north side, between Sixth Avenue and Sheridan Square as viewed from and along Jones Street. The "Pig'n Whistle Inn" is occupving the lower portions of these structures wHich at a later date (as shown in View 2)will revert to their original purpose. No's 177 and 179 are the dormered buildings and are nearest to the Square.
MaY 1, 1933
View 2: September 4, 1938.
P.L. Sperr

710911f-a.text:
175 to 179 W. 4th Street, north side, between Sixth Avenue and Sheridan Square as viewed from and along Jones Street. 709301f-b.text:
(1)
Sixth Ave., north from, West 4th Street, showing in the background, (left to right), a portion of the new Detention House for Women, the tower of the Jefferson Market Court House, and the Empire State Building. Also seen, is the 8th Street Station of the Sixth Ave. Elevated Line.

Late 1936.

P. L. Sperr.
(2)

Sixth Avenue,North from West 4th Street,after the removal of the "L".

January 17th,1939

P. L. Sperr.

709302f-a.text:
Sixth Avenue (right) at the N. W. corner of W. 4th Street, showing "The Swan," an old tavern at this location. West 4th Street is on the left where the streetcar appears. Overhead on the Avenue is the "El" line. This was razed in 1939.

About 1900

J. J. Corell, photo
P. L. Sperr Collection

719230f.text:
2-8 Cornelia Street, at, adjoining, and west of the S.W. corner of West 4th Street.

About 1908.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
